name: chatgpt_env_hospital_gdb_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Hospital + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK, pivot to GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

This GDB configuration for the hospital application is blocked. The GDB housing is not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation due to its single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.The hospital environment also has Hygiene Requirements, and medical/cleanroom applications follow VDI 6022 which recommends C5 corrosion resistance (stainless steel) for hygienic surfaces.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p as an alternative, since it is approved for ENV_HOSPITAL environments.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical engineering mismatch: the user requested a basic, uninsulated, single-wall housing (GDB) for a hospital supply air application. The system correctly blocks this due to hygiene and leakage risks, recommending the double-wall insulated alternative (GDMI) which is standard practice for hospital environments.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as single-wall/uninsulated (PDF p.8) and GDMI as double-wall/insulated (PDF p.11); airflow capacity of 3400 m¬≥/h for size 600x600 is correct in both tables (p.9, p.12).
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's request by explaining why the specific configuration is blocked and providing the correct alternative.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety logic; preventing the use of a single-wall housing in a hospital supply air system avoids significant hygiene and condensation risks.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear engineering logic linking construction type (single-wall vs. double-wall) to application requirements (hygiene/VDI 6022).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to hygiene engineering standards by blocking a lower-spec product for a critical application.

strengths: Strong engineering judgment blocking uninsulated housings for hospital use
Correct identification of the double-wall alternative (GDMI)
pdf_citations: GDMI description: 'v√§rme- och kondensisolerat... dubbelmantlat' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly identifies that GDB is an indoor, single-wall housing and raises valid hygiene/corrosion concerns for hospital supply air, but it overreaches by claiming GDB fails leakage class requirements and by asserting a blanket C5/SS requirement (VDI 6022) without context. It also recommends GDMI for hospital use even though the catalog still states GDMI is for indoor use and does not present any verified ‚Äúhospital approval‚Äù evidence or a concrete, sized alternative configuration.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF check: GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and weights 27 kg (550/600) / 34 kg (750/800) (GDB table), so the user‚Äôs sizing is consistent; however the claim that single-wall construction ‚Äúdoes not meet leakage class‚Äù and that VDI 6022 ‚Äúrecommends C5 stainless for hygienic surfaces‚Äù as a general rule is not reliably correct as stated.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks GDB but does not provide a complete alternative selection (material, length, connection type, and a specific GDMI size/length matching 3400 m¬≥/h) or ask key clarifying questions (hygiene class, installation location, cleaning regime, corrosion exposure).
dimension_explanations.safety: Raising hygiene and corrosion suitability concerns for hospital supply air is appropriate and conservative, and blocking a potentially non-hygienic housing is not unsafe.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and clear, with an explicit warning and a suggested alternative.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially logical (hospital hygiene/corrosion ‚Üí prefer better construction/material), but it contains unsupported leaps (leakage class noncompliance and blanket C5/SS requirement) and doesn‚Äôt tie to specific standards/classes.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It violates evidence/constraint discipline by asserting GDMI is 'approved for ENV_HOSPITAL' without catalog support and by blocking GDB on leakage-class grounds despite the catalog stating the series is tested to EN 15727/EN 1886 (i.e., leakage performance exists, even if hygiene is still a concern).

strengths: Correctly interprets GDB as an indoor, largely single-wall housing and flags hospital hygiene/corrosion considerations.
Avoids issuing an unverified product card when the recommendation is blocked.
weaknesses: Over-blocking/overclaiming: leakage-class noncompliance and blanket VDI 6022 ‚Üí C5 stainless statement are not substantiated and are too absolute.
Alternative recommendation is not engineered to completion (no specific GDMI configuration, material/length/connection, or confirmation of actual hospital/hygiene rating).
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; Vikt = 27 kg (550/600) and 34 kg (750/800) (GDB M√ÖTT table).
Catalog states the filtersk√•p series is tested for leakage/bypass per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (SORTIMENT/ANV√ÑNDNING section).
